item.title: 交易平台 EToro 在 6.2 亿美元扩大首次公开募股规模后大涨 42
item.description: 交易和投资平台 EToro Group Ltd. 及其部分支持者在首次公开募股（IPO）中筹集了近 6.2 亿美元资金，在其成为上市公司后的首个交易日，股价涨幅高达 42%。【原文：EToro Group Ltd. shares rose as much as 42% in its first session as a public company, after the trading and investment platform and some of its backers raised nearly $620 million in an upsized IPO.】

item.title: 苹果准备推出让 Vision Pro 用户用眼睛滚动的功能
item.description: 苹果公司正在为其 Vision Pro 头戴式耳机开发一项功能，让用户可以用眼睛滚动浏览软件，旨在通过新颖的界面增强该设备的功能。【原文：Apple Inc. is developing a feature for its Vision Pro headset that lets users scroll through software with their eyes, aiming to enhance the device with a novel interface.】

item.title: 尼日利亚 Seplat 公司上半年收入超过去年的 11 亿美元
item.description: 尼日利亚最大的石油和天然气勘探公司 Seplat Energy Plc 在提高产量后，预计上半年收入将超过去年的 11 亿美元。【原文：Seplat Energy Plc, Nigeria’s largest oil and gas explorer, expects first-half revenue to exceed last year’s $1.1 billion after ramping-up production.】

item.title: 瑞安-雷诺兹的广告公司 MNTN 首次公开募股，持股人寻求 1.87 亿美元投资
item.description: 互联电视广告平台 MNTN 公司及其部分股东正寻求在首次公开募股中筹集多达 1.87 亿美元的资金，此前由于关税引发的市场波动，该公司推迟了首次公开募股。【原文：Connected TV advertising platform MNTN Inc. and some of its shareholders are seeking to raise as much as $187 million in an initial public offering, after delaying the launch amid tariff-induced market volatility.】

item.title: 杜塔令人不安的经济现实依然存在
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 裕信银行致函德国新政府，提出进行谈判
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）已向德国新政府发出贺信，表示愿意进行谈判，这表明这家意大利银行看到了改善紧张关系的潜在机会。【原文：UniCredit SpA has sent congratulatory letters to the new German government offering talks, according to people familiar with the matter, indicating the Italian bank is seeing a potential opening to improve fraught relations.】

item.title: 挪威为 Blackstone 物流、仓储基金下注 8 亿美元
item.description: 挪威主权财富基金承诺向 Blackstone 公司提供 8 亿美元，用于投资仓库和物流，加大了对北美供应链的押注。【原文：Norway’s sovereign wealth fund committed $800 million to Blackstone Inc. to invest in warehouses and logistics, ratcheting up a bet on North American supply chains.】

item.title: 指称使用可卡因的错误信息让欧洲领导人感到震惊
item.description: 5 月 9 日，基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）、埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）和弗里德里希-梅尔兹（Friedrich Merz）在前往基辅的火车上。【原文：Keir Starmer, Emmanuel Macron and Friedrich Merz on a train to Kyiv on May 9.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司与美国公司签署价值高达 900 亿美元的协议
item.description: 石油巨头沙特阿美石油公司（Saudi Aramco）与美国大型公司签署了总额可能达到约 900 亿美元的协议。【原文：Oil giant Saudi Aramco signed agreements with major US companies potentially totaling about $90 billion.】

item.title: 特朗普纪念币投机者称总统晚宴仅花费 1200 美元
item.description: 莫滕-克里斯滕森（Morten Christensen）说，他和四位热爱加密货币的朋友将参加下周为唐纳德-特朗普总统的memecoin顶级持有者举行的晚宴，每个人的memecoin价格仅为1200美元左右。【原文：Morten Christensen says he and four crypto-loving friends will be attending the dinner next week being held for the top holders of President Donald Trump’s memecoin for just about $1,200 each.】

item.title: 120 天内从热门到冷门：萨克斯债券持有人面临 10 亿美元损失
item.description: 这本应是萨克斯扭转局势所需要的。据说，通过收购陷入困境的竞争对手尼曼-马库斯（Neiman Marcus），这家标志性零售商将成为奢侈品巨头，拥有足够的议价和定价能力来削减成本，提高盈利能力。【原文：It was supposed to be just what Saks needed to turn things around. By taking over struggling rival Neiman Marcus, the pitch went, the iconic retailer would become a luxury powerhouse — one with enough bargaining and pricing power to cut costs and boost profitability.】

item.title: 牛津大学称加拿大对美国的新关税因豁免而降至 "近乎零
item.description: 据牛津经济研究院（Oxford Economics）称，加拿大已有效暂停了几乎所有对美国产品征收的报复性关税，从而抑制了通胀风险，改善了经济增长前景。【原文：Canada has effectively suspended almost all of its retaliatory tariffs on US products, tamping down inflation risks and improving its growth outlook, according to Oxford Economics.】

item.title: 中国暂停对美国实体的出口管制和制裁
item.description: 作为全球最大的两个经济体达成的贸易协定的一部分，中国将暂停对美国实体的出口管制和制裁，这些管制和制裁被称为 "不可靠实体名单"。【原文：China will suspend export controls and sanctions called the unreliable entity list over US entities, which were announced in April, as part of the trade agreements made by the world’s two biggest economies.】

item.title: 议长称巴西需要财政意识才能从贸易战中获益
item.description: 巴西下议院议长雨果-莫塔（Hugo Motta）表示，巴西已成为唐纳德-特朗普对华贸易战的早期赢家，但需要改善财政状况，以吸引投资并充分利用全球动荡。【原文：Brazil has emerged as an early winner from Donald Trump’s trade war with China but needs to get its fiscal situation in order to attract investment and fully capitalize on the global upheaval, according to lower house Speaker Hugo Motta.】

item.title: 优步瞄准通勤族推出更便宜的拼车服务和价格锁定通行证
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. is introducing a cheaper pooled rides option and a price-lock pass for commuters, underscoring its focus on attracting more daily users as consumers confront rising costs.】

item.title: 美国春季购房季迎来五年来最弱开局
item.description: 美国关键的春季房屋销售旺季还未开始，就已经出现了萧条。【原文：The crucial spring home-sales season in the US, barely off the runway, is already sputtering.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮让 Generac 寄望数据中心实现增长
item.description: Generac Holdings 公司以向遭受飓风和冰风暴袭击的家庭提供备用发电机而闻名。现在，它正在追逐一个新的市场：数据中心。【原文：Generac Holdings Inc. made its name providing backup generators to homes whipsawed by hurricanes and ice storms. Now, it’s chasing a new market: data centers.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴数周内第二次升级视频，人工智能热潮持续升温
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司在一个月内第二次更新了其视频生成模型，因为中国企业希望在白热化的人工智能竞赛中更好地与美国竞争对手竞争。【原文：Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. updated its video-generating model for the second time in one month as Chinese firms look to better compete against each other and American rivals in the white-hot AI race.】

item.title: 黄金反弹刺激土耳其囤积者大肆购房买车
item.description: 根据土耳其中央银行的一项新研究，飙升的金价正促使土耳其家庭将金条储蓄转化为大宗商品购买，尤其是房屋和汽车。【原文：Soaring gold prices are prompting Turkish households to convert their bullion savings into big-ticket purchases, especially homes and cars, according to a new study by the country’s central bank.】

item.title: 美国公司抢购短期国债以延长现金持有期限
item.description: 清水公司称，当唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布将其 "解放日 "关税的大部分延期 90 天时，资产超过万亿美元的美国公司抢购了数量空前的短期国债。【原文：US corporations with over a trillion in assets snapped up an unprecedented amount of short-term Treasuries when President Donald Trump announced a 90-day delay for most of his “Liberation Day” tariffs, according to Clearwater.】

item.title: 全球贸易乐观情绪提振大型科技公司，美股稳步走高
item.description: 由于全球最大的芯片制造商股价攀升，以及唐纳德-特朗普总统的海湾之行激起了人们对达成更多贸易协定的预期，美国股市周三震荡走高，有望连续第三天上涨。【原文：US stocks drifted higher Wednesday and were on track for a third straight day of gains, as shares of the world’s largest chipmakers climbed and President Donald Trump’s Gulf tour stoked expectations of additional trade agreements.】

item.title: 首席财务官表示，Sabesp 着眼于债券市场，力争获得投资级评级
item.description: 拉丁美洲最大的公用事业公司--圣保罗州电力公司（Cia. de Saneamento Básico do Estado de São Paulo）的财务主管表示，该公司正准备 20 多年来首次重返债券市场，以寻求获得投资级信用评级。【原文：Latin America’s largest utility, Cia. de Saneamento Básico do Estado de São Paulo, is preparing to return to the bond market for the first time in more than 20 years as it seeks an investment-grade credit rating, according to its finance chief.】

item.title: 在《每日电讯报》被出售之际，英国考虑对外国报刊设置 15%的上限
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，英国计划允许外国拥有英国主要报纸多达 15%的股份，此举可能为《每日电讯报》的出售扫清障碍。【原文：The UK plans to allow foreign states to own up to 15% of key British newspapers, according to a person familiar with the matter, a move that could clear the path for a sale of the Telegraph.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德测试因贸易纷争而停止的债务交易市场
item.description: 中美贸易紧张局势缓和，信贷市场解冻，这至少吸引了一家借款人--布鲁克菲尔德地产零售公司（Brookfield Properties Retail），该公司重新启动了 4 月份搁置的两笔债务销售。【原文：The thaw spreading across credit markets on a reprieve from US-China trade tensions has lured back at least one borrower, Brookfield Properties Retail, as it greenlights two debt sales shelved in April.】

item.title: 美联储杰斐逊认为经济增长放缓，称通胀可能上升
item.description: 美联储副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）表示，关税和相关的不确定性可能会放缓今年的经济增长并刺激通胀，但货币政策已做好充分准备，可根据需要做出应对。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson said tariffs and related uncertainty could slow growth and boost inflation this year, but monetary policy is well positioned to respond as needed.】

item.title: 钴出口禁令即将结束，刚果考虑进一步支持钴出口
item.description: 刚果民主共和国矿业部长表示，该国仍在决定在目前的电池金属出口禁令结束后出台哪些政策来支持钴价。【原文：The Democratic Republic of Congo is still deciding which policies to introduce to support cobalt prices when the current ban on exports of the battery metal ends, according to its mines minister.】

item.title: 据说西班牙电信将为自由电信的 VMO2 股份制定计划
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，西班牙电信公司（Telefonica SA）正在制定一项交易计划，以便控制其与自由全球有限公司（Liberty Global Ltd.）共同拥有的英国合资企业。【原文：Telefonica SA is drawing up plans for a deal that would allow it to take control of the UK joint venture it owns with Liberty Global Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 经济学家追逐受大宗商品动荡冲击的异域市场趋势
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易战引发了各种资产的波动，对冲基金乘着另类市场（从电力、鸡蛋到碳排放）的势头，正承受着巨大的损失。【原文：Hedge funds riding the momentum of alternative markets — everything from electricity and eggs to carbon emissions — are nursing outsized losses as Donald Trump’s trade war whips up volatility across assets.】

item.title: 彼得罗石油公司与中国签署投资协议，考验哥美关系
item.description: 哥伦比亚总统古斯塔沃-彼得罗签署了北京的 "一带一路 "倡议，以促进贸易和中国在哥伦比亚的投资，尽管他的最高外交官强调美国仍然是哥伦比亚的主要盟友。【原文：President Gustavo Petro signed on to Beijing’s Belt and Road initiative in a bid to boost trade and Chinese investment in Colombia, though his top diplomat stressed the US remains the nation’s main ally.】

item.title: 华为卷土重来说明了什么？
item.description: 2019 年，特朗普政府因间谍问题将华为技术有限公司列入黑名单，此举几乎摧毁了这家中国公司的全球智能手机业务。然而，在中国政府的支持下，华为重新崛起，如今已成为中国努力实现技术独立、摆脱西方控制的核心。【原文：When the Trump administration blacklisted Huawei Technologies Co. in 2019 over spying concerns, the move almost wiped out the Chinese company’s global smartphone business. Yet it bounced back with the support of China’s government, and is now at the center of national efforts to achieve technological independence from the West.】
